Question.Subject: Adobe Flash Player on Windows 7?
Question.Content: My computer's system type is 64-bit. But I know that only 32-bit ones work with Adobe Flash Player. So what can I do? I see that I would need to run the 32-bit browser. But is there any detailed step in how to run the 32-bit browser in the 64-bit operating system? GREATLY appreciate your help!
Question.ChosenAnswer:
Hi YCV,
According to Adobe Flash Player site - "Adobe Flash Player is not supported for playback in a 64-bit browser. However, you can run Flash Player in a 32-bit browser running on a 64-bit operating system." For additional information, visit http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/000/6b3af6c9.html.
Cheers, Cassandra Microsoft Windows Outreach

Answer.Content:
Hi YCV,
According to Adobe Flash Player site - "Adobe Flash Player is not supported for playback in a 64-bit browser. However, you can run Flash Player in a 32-bit browser running on a 64-bit operating system." For additional information, visit http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/000/6b3af6c9.html.
Cheers, Cassandra Microsoft Windows Outreach
